title: Charcoal Stove (Italy), 18th century
medium: molded, carved and glazed terracotta; overglaze gilding; turned wood; wrought iron
provenance: Mrs. Henry E. Huntington; 1923: acquired by the Museum
dimensions:
H x diam.: 94 × 50.8 cm (37 × 20 in.)
Weight: 31.3 kg (69 lb.)
creditline: Gift of Mrs. Henry E. Huntington
description: Blue glazed and gilded earthenware brazier/stove on wooden casters. Molded masks on upper corners. Shaped lid culminating in a gilt bronze urn.

tombstone.epitaph:
Charcoal Stove (Italy), 18th century; molded, carved and glazed terracotta; overglaze gilding; turned wood; wrought iron; H x diam.: 94 × 50.8 cm (37 × 20 in.)
Weight: 31.3 kg (69 lb.); Gift of Mrs. Henry E. Huntington; 1923-23-1-a,b
